title: Cú Chulainn
summary: Cú Chulainn (/kuːˈkʌlɪn/ koo-KUL-in,[1][2] Irish: [kuːˈxʊlˠɪn̠ʲ] (listen); "Culann's Hound") and sometimes known in English as Cuhullin,[lower-alpha 1] was an Irish mythological demigod who appears in the stories of the Ulster Cycle, as well as in Scottish and Manx mythology.[3] He is believed to be an incarnation of the Irish god Lugh, who is also his father.[4][5][6] His mother is the mortal Deichtine, sister of Conchobar mac Nessa.[7]
